reviewText:
This is a re-adapted overlay of 2 other games of Digital Homicide's: Starship Nova Strike and Hovering Helideath, which are in themselves blatant reskins of the same game. To the point where the Starship novastrike unity launcher form their Itch.io deployment of the game had hovering helideath blatantly staring at you on the launcher.

Bland, ultra generic, and the only abundace you will find here is the quantity of boredom to be obtained from Mini Attack Submarine or ANY of the offerings from Digital Homicide. Save yourself. Don't buy these games.

See what I mean here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t__HuQYLglQ
voteText: 42 of 44 people (95%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: Ran through five minutes of this game, only to find that they changed the assets from the itch.io version, and made them much less common. I ran through four levels" and saw at most two dozen creatures
date:
and died exactly once by skimming the bottom.

Starship: Nova Strike at least required that I do something other than hold the down-arrow key.

Project-flipping at its finest. Mini-Attack sub is the earliest of the three games that are on this particular template: Starship: Nova Strike was the last
recommended: released on Steam some weeks ago. The middle child is Hovering Heli death
voteText: and currently resides in the top 100 games.\n\nSave your money."

reviewText:
Originally covered on a live stream I did with The Annoying Atheist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=983tcAz_etA

THIS, THIS, THIS! I'm not even sure what to call This"

Mini Attack Submarine
date: where to f*cking begin? I feel like the reason this game was called MINI attack submarine was because the devs couldn't be bothered to scale all the monsters to be the correct size to the actual submarine so they decided to take a shortcut and just scale down the sub and call the game MINI attack submarine.\n\nEverything looks dull and not good to look at
recommended:
it's probably their drabbest looking game yet.

You can also easily go through the world by simply hitting revers when the game starts up aswell.

I feel like when Digital Homicide make a new game

column16:
is 3D and you frequently move around this 3D environment but it has the models of the sub and enemy fish going at a 2D point. This actually made me get a bit of a headache when I was playing it.

The problem is with MAS is that it's giving me barely anything to work with. That's also why this review is short.

Pros
+ It's different from what they've done previously... no
column17:
I can't use tht cus of Starship Nova Strike....it's simple?

Cons
- Boring
- Dull graphics
- Terrible use of both 2D and 3D
- Bugs
- Can give you a headache

Final verdict: 2/10

reviewText: Another crappy side scrolling shooter from Digital Homicide. This game is pretty much Starship: Nova Strike but under water rather than in space.\n\nThe most recent games they released and their current Greenlight games makes me think they got all their ideas from Action 52 for the NES.

reviewText: I get why everyone hates it... I mean, I see where they're coming from. But, come on. It's a fun game, it helps me relax and enjoy a casual experience compared to my usual games. I like games like these.
